_comment: I am using a _ instance of each field for comments.
_idleTimeoutInMinutes: Use 0 to disable automatic shutdown of ROS and server reset after idle timeout
_rosLibDelay: In Seconds. How long to delay between polling ROS for parameters. Decrease to make parameters on the web interafce update faster, however it will increase the CPU/Memory load on the system. 5 to 10 is reasonable.
_pushover: If you use pushover include your tokens here.
_twilio: Required data to use Twilio if you want
_ngrok: This allows you to use a consistent ngrok so twilio can find it but you have to pay for it. I no longer use ngrok.
_cloudServer: For use if you have a cloud based server that the robot communicates with for various online functions.
_useMasterPowerRelay: Set to true if you have a 'Master Relay' to turn off all power to the robot.
_useLCD: Set to true if you have an Adafruit LCD Display on the robot.
_useUSBrelay: Set to true if you have a USB Relay board
_use_xv11: Set to true if you have an XV11 neato scanner connected.
_camera0: Set to true if you have a USB camera.
_camera0name: Run 'fswebcam --verbose --device=/dev/video0 2>&1|grep cap.card' and set this to a unique part of the resulting string.
_camera1: Set to true if you have a USB 2nd camera.
_camera1name: Run 'fswebcam --verbose --device=/dev/video1 2>&1|grep cap.card' and set this to a unique part of the resulting string.
_wait_for_door_confirmation: Set to true if you want the robot to always start disabled, waiting for you to confirm a door is shut
_door_list: List of doors to pre-populate for confirmation
_hasXboxController: Set to true if you have a USB wireless xBox joystick receiver.
_hasScanseSweep: Set to true if you have a Scanse Sweep installed on the robot.
_arlobotModel: Use this to use an alternate URD file, otherwise use set to default
_hasActivityBoard: This can only be false for a 'dummy' test system that has no actual hardware.
_hasQuickStartBoard: My roobt has a SECOND Prpoeller board called  'Quck Start Board' that runs the PING sensors.
_speechVolumeLevelDefault: Default volume level for speech. 0 to 100
_speechProgram: Set this to a script that will convert text to speech and play it. Use 'nodeSay' if you do not have one. You can also use 'espeak' if you install it on your system.
_batteryConsideredFullAt: Percentage at which laptop battery is considered full. Some never get to 100%

relays._has_fiveVolt: Set this to true if you have a relay controlling a 5 volt power converter to run required items.
relays._fiveVolt: List the number on the USB Relay controller that controls the 5 volt power converter.
relays._has_arduino: Set this to true if you have a relay controlling a voltage converter with an Arduiono attached.
relays._arduino: List the number on the USB Relay controller that controls the Arduino attached.
relays._has_lightOne: Set if you have a light attached to a USB Relay
relays._lightOne: List the number on the USB Relay controller that controls the first light attached.
relays._has_lightTwo: Set if you have a second light attached to a USB Relay
relays._lightTwo: List the number on the USB Relay controller that controls the second light attached.
relays._has_leftMotor: Set if you have the Left Motor attached to a USB Relay
relays._leftMotor: List the number on the USB Relay controller that Left Motor is attached to.
relays._has_rightMotor: Set if you have the Right Motor attached to a USB Relay
relays._rightMotor: List the number on the USB Relay controller that right Motor is attached to.
relays._speaker: Relay used to turn on speaker by rapid power cycliing it.

_hasBeenEdited: Set to true once you have put your settings in this file to let the program know that you did it.
